description: Commercial building templates - offices, retail shops, cafes/restaurants, and food courts with comprehensive measurement assumptions and productivity standards

templates.name: Small Office
templates.description: Single storey small office, 150m² GFA, cavity brick with metal stud, flat roof, slab on ground

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 90mm cavity + 90mm metal stud + 13mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Commercial GFA measured from internal faces of external walls at 1.4m height. Includes office, reception, meeting rooms, toilets, kitchenette. Excludes carpark, external plant.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Small office suitable for 12-15 staff. Open plan maximum 80m² with 3.0m ceiling allows natural ventilation and daylighting. Private offices sized for executive/manager roles. Bathroom provision = 1 WC per 8m² office area (approximately 2 toilets for 150m²).

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 cubicle per 75m² GFA (150m² = 2 cubicles minimum). Each toilet requires 1 basin. Not linear with GFA.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 150m² ÷ 75m² per toilet = 2 cubicles

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 kitchenette per 75m² GFA. Includes sink, cooktop, fridge space, benchtop.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 150m² ÷ 75m² = 1 kitchenette

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1-2 zones per storey for open plan. Meeting rooms separate zone.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 150m² single storey = 1 main zone + 1 secondary zone

external_wall_area.waste_applied: Cavity brick 1.07 (7% waste) = 94.4m² for material takeoff

roof_area.formula: Roof Area = GFA × 1.15 (pitch factor for flat/low-slope roof)

flooring.formula: Floor Finish Area = GFA (all areas receive finish)

power_points.notes: Standard office workstation (6-8m²) requires 2-3 power points. 38 points includes desk circuits, floor boxes.

light_points.notes: Includes ceiling penetrations, emergency lighting, task lighting.

plumbing_fixtures.waste_applied: Plumbing pipe 1.05 (5% waste) for rough-in routing

cavity_brickwork.derivation: External walls 94.4m² ÷ 5.78 m²/day = 16.3 person-days, ÷ 2 = 8.2 days (3-person gang)

painting_interior.wall_area_derivation: 150m² × 4 walls ÷ 3.0m ceiling = 200 m² wall area, 200m² ÷ 2.5 m²/hr = 80 hours = 10 days (1 painter)
painting_interior.surface_prep_addition: +30% for surface prep (9mm blockboard backing, joint finishing)

electrical_installation.first_fix_roughin: 38 power points × 0.4 hrs = 15.2 hours; 25 light points × 0.7 hrs = 17.5 hours; total first-fix ~34 hours
electrical_installation.second_fix_final: 38 power outlets × 0.3 hrs = 11.4 hours; switches/testing ~8 hours; total ~20 hours
electrical_installation.derivation: 54 hours labour ÷ 8 hrs/day = 6.75 days (1.5 person team)

plumbing_installation.fixture_labour: 2 WC suites × 2.5 hrs = 5 hrs; 3 basins × 2.0 hrs = 6 hrs; total fixtures ~11 hours
plumbing_installation.rough_in_drainage: Approximate 60m pipe rough-in, 60m ÷ 10m per 4 hrs = 24 hours rough-in

hvac_mechanical.installation_time: 16-20 hours for indoor + outdoor units + ductwork

templates.name: Medium Office
templates.description: Two storey medium office, 400m² GFA, cavity brick with metal stud, flat roof with metal deck

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 90mm cavity + 90mm metal stud + 13mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Commercial GFA measured from internal faces at 1.4m height. Ground floor: reception, open plan, meeting rooms, toilets, kitchenette. First floor: open plan office, manager offices, meeting room, toilets.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Medium office supports 30-40 staff across two storeys. GFA 400m² = 200m² per storey. Stairwell ~12m² per floor (not double-counted in GFA per NCC). Toilet provision = 1 WC per 50m² (400m² = 8 WC minimum, provided as 6 cubicles + 8 basins). Ceiling height 3.0m supports mechanical services above suspended ceiling.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Single central stairwell serves 2 storeys. Width 1.2m (code minimum), landing 2.0m × 2.0m. Approximately 18-20 treads.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 1 stairwell × 22 steps × 2 flights = 1 stair run per template (not scaled with GFA)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 cubicle per 50m² (commercial minimum). Ground + First = 400m² ÷ 50 = 8 cubicles (split into 4 per floor + adjacent basins).
nonlinear_items.derivation: 400m² ÷ 50m² = 8 WC cubicles + 8 basins = non-linear count

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 2-3 zones per storey (north + south exposure). 2 storeys = 4-6 zones minimum.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Ground floor (perimeter exposure) = 2 zones; First floor = 2 zones

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Not required for 2 storeys under NCC. Accessible ramp required if public access.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Small building exemption (≤2000m² and ≤2 storeys allows stairs only)

perimeter_calculation.note: Each storey has independent perimeter; total building perimeter multiplied by 2 for external wall calculation

external_wall_area.formula: Wall Area = Perimeter × Ceiling Height × Number of Storeys

floor_structure.formula: Upper floor = GFA storey area + beams/joists, typically +5-8% for structural depth
floor_structure.calculation: 200m² × 1.08 = 216m² (includes structural beam zones in GFA measurement)

internal_wall_framing.wall_area: 64m × 3.0m height = 192m² partition area × 2 faces = 384m² stud framing

flooring_finish.calculation: 400m² polished concrete screed + carpet tiles (60% of area)
flooring_finish.waste_applied: Concrete base 1.05 (5%); Carpet 1.15 (15% waste) = 230m² screed + 276m² carpet tiles

ceiling_finish.formula: Ceiling = GFA × 1.08 (suspended ceiling with minor void)

power_points_commercial.distribution: 60 at desks (open plan), 30 at manager offices, 10 at meeting/service areas

light_points.distribution: LED recessed downlights over office areas, task lighting in meeting rooms

plumbing_fixtures.calculation: 400m² ÷ 30 = 13.3 → 14 fixtures minimum (8 WC cubicles + 8 basins + 2 service sinks)

cavity_brickwork.derivation: External walls 217.6m² ÷ 5.78 m²/day = 37.6 person-days, ÷ 2 bricklayers = 18.8 days (3-person gang at ~25 m²/day team rate)

flooring_installation.derivation: 230m² screed ÷ 40 m²/day = 5.75 days; 276m² carpet ÷ 25 m²/day = 11 days

painting_interior_walls_ceilings.derivation: 1,220m² walls ÷ 2.5 m²/hr = 488 hours; 432m² ceiling ÷ 1.5 m²/hr = 288 hours; total ~776 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day = 97 days (1 painter, or 48 days with 2-person team)

electrical_two_storey.first_fix_roughin: 100 power points × 0.4 hrs = 40 hrs; 66 light points × 0.7 hrs = 46 hrs; stairwell circuits = 8 hrs; total ~94 hours first-fix
electrical_two_storey.second_fix_final: 100 power × 0.3 = 30 hrs; 66 lights × 0.2 = 13 hrs; switchboards, testing = 15 hrs; total ~58 hours
electrical_two_storey.gang_size: 1 electrician + 1 apprentice (2-person); may split to 2 teams for parallel work
electrical_two_storey.derivation: 152 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day ÷ 2 person-team = 9.5 days (or 19 days single electrician)

plumbing_two_storey.first_fix_roughin: 8 WC suites × 2.5 hrs = 20 hrs; 8 basins × 2.0 hrs = 16 hrs; 2 service sinks × 2.5 hrs = 5 hrs; rough-in ~80m pipe = ~40 hours; total ~81 hours
plumbing_two_storey.derivation: 106 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day ÷ 2 person = 6.6 days (or 13 days single plumber)

hvac_systems.system_type: 2-3 zone mini-split or central system with multiple floor risers
hvac_systems.installation_time: 24-32 hours for 400m² (ductwork, indoor + outdoor units, thermostats, testing)

templates.name: Large Office
templates.description: Multi-storey large office, 1200m² GFA, cavity brick with metal stud, flat roof

specifications.construction_notes: 110mm face brick + 90mm cavity + 90mm metal stud + 13mm plasterboard

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Commercial GFA 1200m² across 3 storeys = 400m² per level. Measured from internal faces at 1.4m. Each floor: open office, meeting rooms, management suites, toilets, circulation. Excludes below-ground car parking per NCC definition.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Large office CBD building supports 80-120 staff across 3 storeys. Ceiling height 3.2m (0.2m increase over small office for larger span) accommodates major HVAC runs and provides airy feel. Requires external lift access. Toilet provision = 1 WC per 40m² commercial area (1200m² = 30 WC, provided as 24 cubicles + 30 basins). Emergency egress via stairwells + lifts.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 2 stairwells (egress code minimum) + 2 passenger lifts for 3-storey, 1200m². Each stairwell ~20m² per floor = 60m² (not doubled in GFA). Each lift shaft ~15m² × 3 floors = internal void.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 stairwells + 2 lifts = building servicing infrastructure (counted in circulation area only)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 WC per 40m² (commercial CBD standard = higher density). 1200m² ÷ 40 = 30 WC cubicles + 30 basins distributed: 6 cubicles + 6 basins per toilet block × 2 blocks per floor × 3 floors
nonlinear_items.derivation: 30 WC fixtures × 2.5 hrs = 75 hours plumbing installation

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 4-6 zones per storey (perimeter + core zones). 3 storeys × 5 zones average = 15 zones minimum for CBD building with full air-conditioning.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 15 HVAC zones with main plant room on ground floor + rooftop unit

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 2 passenger lifts minimum for 1200m² / 3 storeys per NCC accessibility. Each lift = ~15m² shaft footprint + 12m rope height per 3.2m storey.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 lifts × 18-22 hours installation each = 40-44 hours (specialist lift installer)

perimeter_calculation.note: Each of 3 storeys has ~48m perimeter (all footprints equal)

external_wall_area.formula: Wall Area = Perimeter × Ceiling Height × Number of Storeys + Parapet

roof_area.waste_applied: Metal roofing 1.05 (5% waste) = 483m² installed (includes plant room roof, lift overruns)

floor_structures.formula: Upper Floors = GFA per storey + structural allowance
floor_structures.calculation: 400m² × 3 = 1200m² + 5% structural zones = 1260m² (includes stairwell, lift void intrusions)

ceiling_finishes.formula: Suspended Ceiling = GFA × 1.06 (minor voids for services)

power_points.distribution: Open office 200m² = 50 pts; exec suites 60m² = 25 pts; meeting 35m² = 15 pts; per level; 3 levels

light_points.calculation: 1200m² ÷ 6 = 200 light points (LED recessed, emergency lighting, task)

plumbing_fixtures.calculation: 1200m² ÷ 40 = 30 fixtures (24 WC cubicles + 30 basins + 4 service sinks)

cavity_brickwork.multiplier: 1.10 (5+ person team efficiency gain, large repetitive task)
cavity_brickwork.derivation: 525.2m² ÷ 5.78 m²/day = 90.8 person-days ÷ 3 bricklayers = 30.3 days; large gang effect = 30.3 ÷ 1.10 = 27.5 days

metal_stud_and_plasterboard.gang_size: 3 carpenters + 2 labourers (framing); 4-6 fixers rotating across floors (plasterboard)

flooring_installation.gang_size: 2 floor layers + 1 labourer (can rotate between floors)
flooring_installation.derivation: 1260m² screed ÷ 35 m²/day = 36 days; carpet varies per floor

painting.total_area: Internal wall area (floor area × 4 / height) × 3 floors ≈ 2800m² + 1200m² ceiling = 4000m² paint
painting.derivation: 4000m² ÷ (2.5 m²/hr average) = 1600 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day = 200 days (1 painter); with 3-person team = 67 days

electrical_large_building.first_fix: 300 power × 0.4 hrs = 120 hrs; 200 lights × 0.7 = 140 hrs; main switchboard + subboards = 20 hrs; emergency systems = 15 hrs; total ~295 hours first-fix
electrical_large_building.second_fix: Power terminations = 60 hrs; light connections = 40 hrs; testing + commissioning = 30 hrs; total ~130 hours
electrical_large_building.gang_size: 2 electricians + 2 apprentices (4-person, can split to 2 teams on different floors)
electrical_large_building.multiplier: 1.08 (large CBD building, Building Code compliance, emergency egress lighting)
electrical_large_building.derivation: 425 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day ÷ 4 person = 13.3 days (or 53 days single electrician)

plumbing_large_building.first_fix: 24 WC × 2.5 hrs = 60 hrs; 30 basins × 2.0 = 60 hrs; 4 service sinks = 10 hrs; rough-in 180m pipe = 90 hrs; total ~220 hours
plumbing_large_building.second_fix: Fixture connections, testing, sealing, pressure test = ~60 hours
plumbing_large_building.gang_size: 2 plumbers + 2 apprentices (can work simultaneously on different floors)
plumbing_large_building.multiplier: 1.10 (3-storey vertical rises, pressure testing, public building code compliance)
plumbing_large_building.derivation: 280 hours ÷ 8 hrs/day ÷ 2 person = 17.5 days (or 35 days single plumber)

hvac_systems.system_type: Central plant + zone controllers, 15 zones across 3 floors
hvac_systems.installation_time: 80-100 hours (main plant room setup, ductwork runs to all floors, thermostats, controls programming, commissioning)
hvac_systems.gang_size: 2 HVAC technicians + 1 apprentice (may coordinate with mechanical engineer on-site)
hvac_systems.multiplier: 1.15 (complex zoning, inter-floor ductwork, building automation controls)

lifts_and_vertical_transport.installation_time: 20-24 hours per lift (factory-only work, shaft inspection, rope rigging, brake testing, code compliance)
lifts_and_vertical_transport.gang_size: 1 qualified lift mechanic + 1 electrician + 1 assistant (3-person specialist team)

templates.name: Small Retail Shop
templates.description: Single storey small retail shop, 80m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Retail GFA includes shop floor (display + sales), stockroom, fitting rooms, cashier, toilets. Measured from internal faces at 1.4m height. Excludes external plant, loading dock exterior.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Small retail (80m²) typical for shopping centre tenancy. Assumes leased space, not standalone. Display fit-out includes wall shelving, floor fixtures for clothing/shoes. Stockroom uses high racking (assume 2.4m usable height, ceiling 3.0m). Ceiling height 3.0m is standard for retail (allows visibility of stock + merchandise display). Toilet provision: 1 WC per 50m² retail = 1.6 → 2 WC typical (provided as 1 cubicle + 1 public WC). Customer-facing counter 4m long × 0.9m deep.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Perimeter shelving = Perimeter × 1.8m height (typical retail), plus island fixtures. Non-linear with GFA.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 80m² → perimeter ~35m; shelving runs ~30m (not all walls) × 1.8m = 54m²

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 1 fitting room per 30-50m² retail floor. 80m² = 2 fitting rooms (small retail provision).
nonlinear_items.derivation: Not scaled linearly; fixed at 2 rooms per small retail unit

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 WC per 50m² retail floor area (80m² = 1.6 WC); provide 2 (1 staff, 1 public minimum)
nonlinear_items.derivation: 80m² ÷ 50 = 1.6 WC → 2 cubicles

external_wall_area.calculation: 21.4m × 3.0m = 64.2m² (includes shop front glass area, ~30% of wall)
external_wall_area.waste_applied: Rendered block 1.07 (7% waste) = 68.7m² masonry only (subtract window frames)

shop_fit_out_cabinetry.formula: Display Shelving = Perimeter × 1.8m display height + island fixtures
shop_fit_out_cabinetry.calculation: 21.4m × 1.8m ≈ 38.5m² (back wall, left, right walls) + 8m² island = 46.5m² of fitted cabinetry surfaces
shop_fit_out_cabinetry.notes: Fitted shelving requires custom carpentry/joinery; installation labour-intensive

power_points_retail.formula: Power = GFA ÷ 3m² (retail higher density than office, for EFT terminals, fridges, lighting)
power_points_retail.distribution: Checkout counter (6 pts), perimeter shelving (12 pts), fitting rooms (3 pts), stockroom (6 pts)

light_points.notes: Include display lighting, accent lighting over key merchandise zones

shop_front_framing.item: Shop front ~12m wide × 3.0m tall (standard retail), includes glazing frame, door frame, security shutter track
shop_front_framing.installation_time: 2-3 days (frame assembly, glazing installation, security hardware)

display_shelving_custom_joinery.labour_rate: 0.3-0.5 labour-hours per m² (custom cabinetry, assembly on-site)

painting.wall_area: 64.2m² perimeter × 3.0m = 192.6m² walls (less 30% shop front) = ~135m² + 84m² ceiling = 219m² total

electrical_retail.derivation: 30.8 hours labour ÷ 8 hrs/day = 3.85 → 4 hours minimum call-out applies

plumbing_retail.fixtures: 2 WC × 2.5 hrs = 5 hrs; 2 basins × 2.0 hrs = 4 hrs; rough-in ~20m = 8 hrs; total ~17 hours
plumbing_retail.derivation: 17 hours labour (applies typical rates, no minimum call-out penalty)

templates.name: Medium Retail Shop
templates.description: Single storey medium retail shop, 150m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Retail GFA measured from internal faces. Includes: sales floor with island + perimeter fixtures, fitting rooms, stockroom, checkouts, toilets, preparation room.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Medium retail (150m²) serves ~15-20 customers comfortably. Typical for specialty clothing, homewares, or department store tenancy. Stockroom 30m² (20% of GFA) typical for retail. Ceiling 3.0m supports high shelf racking (2.4m usable, 0.6m to ceiling). Fitting rooms: 1 per 30m² sales floor = 3-4 rooms. Toilet: 1 WC per 50m² = 3 WC (provided as 2-3 cubicles + 3 basins). Island fixtures non-linear; typical for medium retail = 1 main island.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 1 main island per 100m² retail, plus perimeter shelving. Medium (150m²) = 1 island + perimeter runs.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Island 3m × 1.5m × 1.8m high (approx 27m² perimeter footprint)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 fitting room per 30m² sales floor. 90m² sales = 3 fitting rooms (not 150m² total).
nonlinear_items.derivation: 150m² ÷ 50 = 3 fitting rooms

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Stockroom area 20-25% of GFA. 150m² × 0.20 = 30m² stockroom; shelving height 2.4m usable.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Non-linear; fixed at 30m² for medium retail

display_shelving.formula: Perimeter Shelving + Island = √(GFA×4) × 1.8m height + island fixture area

templates.name: Large Retail Shop
templates.description: Single storey large retail shop, 300m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Large retail GFA 300m² includes expansive sales floor, multiple fitting rooms, large stockroom, preparation area, checkouts, staff room, toilets.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Large retail (300m²) major department store or specialty chain tenancy. Stockroom 60m² (20% GFA) substantial for high-volume retail. Ceiling 3.0m for visibility. Multiple island fixtures support high-traffic display. Fitting room provision: 1 per 25m² sales floor = 7-8 rooms (provide 8). Toilet: 1 per 50m² retail = 6 WC (provide as 3-4 cubicles + 4 basins). Staff facilities included (meeting NCC accessibility).

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 island per 75m² retail (300m² = 4 islands typical)
nonlinear_items.derivation: 4 islands × 3m × 1.5m = 18m² floor footprint, 27m² perimeter per island

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 per 25m² sales floor. 180m² ÷ 25 = 7.2 → 8 rooms
nonlinear_items.derivation: 8 rooms, not linear with total GFA

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 service counter per 100m² retail (300m² = 2-3 alteration/service points)
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 service stations for tailoring, customer service

display_shelving.formula: Perimeter Shelving + Islands = Perimeter × 1.8m + (4 islands × 27m² perimeter per island)

display_shelving.labour_rate: 0.35-0.4 hrs/m² (assembly-line efficiency for multiple identical islands)

templates.name: Small Cafe/Restaurant
templates.description: Single storey small cafe/restaurant, 100m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Cafe GFA includes dining/seating area, commercial kitchen (food prep + cooking), serving counter, toilets, storage.
measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Small cafe (100m²) seats 20-25 customers comfortably. Seating area per NCC = min 1.5m²/diner for tables + circulation. Kitchen 30% of GFA typical for food service (100m² × 0.30 = 30m² kitchen per hospitality standards). Ceiling height 3.0m supports commercial extraction hoods + services. Toilet provision: 1 WC per 50m² café = 2 cubicles (separate staff WC may be required under Food Safety Code). Grease trap and commercial drainage required (not shown in GFA but critical for fitout).

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Oven, cooktop, range hood, prep benches, sinks (3-compartment wash sink required). 30m² kitchen space = typically 4-6 major pieces + benches.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Not scaled; fixed to kitchen area 30m²

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 50m² dining ÷ 2.0m² per diner = 25 covers (table + chair footprint)
nonlinear_items.derivation: 25 covers × 2m² = 50m² (including circulation, POS)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 grease trap required for any food service (non-linear). Typically 50-75 litre capacity for 100m² cafe.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Single grease trap installation, ~1 day labour

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 cubicle per 50m² dining/kitchen = 2 cubicles minimum. Staff access separate WC recommended.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 cubicles + 2 basins minimum

external_wall_area.calculation: 24m × 3.0m = 72m² (cafe typically has large window/glazing frontage, ~40% = ~29m² glass, ~43m² masonry)

flooring.calculation: 100m² (typically non-slip vinyl or concrete tiles for food safety)

kitchen_flooring_special.formula: Kitchen floor = kitchen_area (food-grade epoxy or tiles with grout, slip-resistant)

kitchen_extraction.formula: Extraction ducting = Kitchen perimeter × 1.5 (hood ductwork to roof) ≈ ~25m ducting
kitchen_extraction.notes: Commercial extraction hood required for food prep area (NCC F5, health code)

power_points_cafe.formula: Power = GFA ÷ 3m² (cafe has high electrical load for kitchen equipment)
power_points_cafe.distribution: Kitchen equipment (12 pts: cooktop, oven, extraction, fridges); Serving counter (6 pts: espresso, POS, fridge); Dining area (8 pts: table outlets, lighting); Toilets (2 pts)

light_points.calculation: 100m² ÷ 4 = 25 light points + 2 over-counter task lights = 27 points

plumbing_fixtures_cafe.calculation: 100m² ÷ 50 = 2 WC cubicles + 3-compartment food wash sink + hand wash basin (food handler requirement) + beverage dispenser (espresso) water = ~6 water points

gas_supply_cafe.formula: Gas line = Kitchen to meter, ~10-15m typical for small cafe
gas_supply_cafe.notes: Commercial gas supply for cooktop/oven; propane or natural gas

kitchen_fitout.item: Commercial kitchen benches, sink runs, equipment connections

electrical_cafe.kitchen_circuits: Heavy circuits for cooktop/oven + 3-phase capability = +10 hours

plumbing_cafe.fixtures_and_rough_in: 2 WC × 2.5 + 3-compartment sink × 3 + hand wash × 2 + rough-in ~30m = 40 hours labour
plumbing_cafe.gas_connection: Gas line to cooktop/oven = 4-6 hours (certified fitter)
plumbing_cafe.gang_size: 1 plumber + 1 apprentice; separate gas fitter for gas work
plumbing_cafe.derivation: 40 hours plumbing ÷ 8 hrs/day = 5 days; gas ~6 hours = 0.75 days

kitchen_extraction.item: Commercial extraction hood + ducting to roof, grease trap installation
kitchen_extraction.labour_hours: 16-20 hours (hood installation, ducting, grease trap connection, testing)

templates.name: Medium Cafe/Restaurant
templates.description: Single storey medium cafe/restaurant, 200m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Medium cafe GFA 200m² includes larger dining area, extended kitchen with preparation and storage, bar/counter service, separate toilets, manager office, stock areas.

typical_layout.kitchen_prep_cooking: 50m² (main cooking, food prep, plating, walk-in fridge space)

measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Medium cafe (200m²) serves 50-60 covers, 2-3 shifts typical. Kitchen 50m² (25% of GFA) provides space for multi-station cooking (grill, pasta, beverages). Ceiling 3.0m with extra clearance for larger extraction hood (two units may be required). Toilet provision: 1 per 50m² = 4 cubicles (public + staff separate). Separate staff facilities + manager office (not typical in small cafe). Multiple water/gas/electrical zones for kitchen equipment.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically: 1 cooking zone (grill/cooktop) per 25m² kitchen area + prep/plating + beverage bar. 50m² kitchen = 2-3 cooking zones.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 cooking zones + prep zone + beverage bar

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 hood per 25m² kitchen area (or per 2-3 cooking stations). 50m² kitchen = 2 hoods minimum.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 2 extraction hoods + ducting

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 per 100-150m² total GFA for food-service buildings. 200m² = 1 walk-in fridge (5m × 2m × 2.1m high = ~10m³).
nonlinear_items.derivation: Not scaled; fixed at 1 per building

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 trap per building, capacity scales: 75-100L for 50-75 seat cafe; 150L for 100+ seats. 200m² = 100-150L grease trap.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Single trap, larger capacity (150L typical)

kitchen_extraction.formula: Ducting = Kitchen perimeter × 1.5 + run to roof, 2 hoods

power_points_cafe.distribution: Kitchen (20 pts: cooktop, oven, extraction ×2, fridges, prep); Bar counter (8 pts); Dining (15 pts); Back-of-house (10 pts); Circulation (14 pts)

plumbing_fixtures.calculation: 200m² ÷ 50 = 4 WC + 2 × 3-compartment food wash sinks + beverage dispenser + hand basins = ~8 water points

kitchen_fitout.item: Benches, sinks, equipment connections, walk-in fridge installation
kitchen_fitout.labour_hours: 60-75 hours (larger kitchen, more equipment, more connections)

electrical.gang_size: 1 electrician + 1 apprentice (may require 2 teams for parallel work)

plumbing.plumbing_labour: 4 WC × 2.5 + 2 × 3-comp sinks × 3 + hand basins × 4 + rough-in ~50m = 60 hours
plumbing.gas_labour: Gas to 2 cooktop zones + oven = 8 hours (certified)
plumbing.gang_size: 1 plumber + 1 apprentice; 1 gas fitter for gas work
plumbing.derivation: 60 hours plumbing ÷ 8 hrs/day = 7.5 days; 8 hours gas = 1 day

extraction_grease_trap.item: 2 extraction hoods + 30m ducting + 150L grease trap installation
extraction_grease_trap.labour_hours: 24-28 hours (more complex installation than small cafe)

templates.name: Food Court
templates.description: Single storey food court, 500m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Food court GFA includes 4-6 individual food outlets, large communal seating area, common food prep zones, shared services, toilets, storage.

typical_layout.seating_area: 250m² (approximately 120-150 covers at 2.0m² per seat, with circulation)
typical_layout.food_outlets: 150m² (4-6 small kitchen zones, 25-30m² each, shared equipment)
typical_layout.common_prep_areas: 40m² (central dish washing, food receiving, storage prep)
typical_layout.toilets: 20m² (4 cubicles + 4 basins, public; separate staff access)

measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Food court (500m²) is high-capacity shared food service facility, typical for shopping centres. Multiple independent food vendors (4-6) share seating, common services. Ceiling height 3.5m (0.5m taller than cafe) accommodates large extraction system serving multiple outlets + ventilation for high-volume dining. Central dish wash area (not per-outlet kitchens). Toilet provision: 1 WC per 50m² = 10 cubicles (provide 4-6 cubicles + public basins). Multiple gas/electrical meters, separate utility feeds for each vendor.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 4-6 independent outlets. 150m² kitchen ÷ 5 outlets = 30m² per outlet average. Each requires: cooktop/oven, prep bench, 1-2 sinks, fridge.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 5 outlets × 30m² = 150m² kitchen area (non-linear; depends on outlet mix)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 large central hood with plenum (500mm × 1.5m × 0.3m) serving entire food court. Ducting to roof ~25-30m with multiple branch takeoffs.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Single large system, 60-80 hours installation

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Multiple outlets = larger grease trap. 500m² food court = 300-400L grease trap (vs. 75-150L for cafe).
nonlinear_items.derivation: Single large grease trap (non-linear scaling)

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 commercial 3-door dishwasher or conveyor dishwasher for multi-outlet facility. Not per-outlet.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 1 shared dishwasher + hand-wash sinks in common area

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 250m² seating ÷ 2.0m² per diner = 125 covers (open floor plan, flexible furniture)
nonlinear_items.derivation: Modular seating, ~125 covers

external_wall_area.calculation: 53.7m × 3.5m = 188.0m² (food court typically has moderate glazing, ~30% = ~56m² glass, ~132m² masonry)

ceiling.formula: Ceiling = GFA × 1.08 (exposed plenum for extraction ducting)

central_extraction.formula: Ducting = Plenum box + branch lines to roof + main line, ~30-40m total
central_extraction.calculation: 4 outlets × 5m branch = 20m + main run ~15m = 35m approximate ducting

power_points.formula: Power = GFA ÷ 2.5m² (food service high electrical density)
power_points.distribution: Outlets (15 pts each × 5 = 75 pts); Seating (40 pts: charging); Shared services (50 pts: dishwasher, freezers, prep); Circulation/emergency (35 pts)

light_points.formula: Lights = GFA ÷ 3.5m² (food court well-lit for food service)

plumbing_fixtures.formula: Fixtures = 1 per 50m² + shared food service sinks
plumbing_fixtures.calculation: 500m² ÷ 50 = 10 WC + 5 × 3-compartment food wash sinks + hand basins + hot water service = ~20 water connection points

metal_roof.rate: 60 m²/day (2-person team); large area = higher efficiency

food_outlet_kitchen_fitout.item: 5 independent kitchen zones (benches, equipment, plumbing connections per outlet)
food_outlet_kitchen_fitout.gang_size: 2 kitchen installers + 2 labourers (can work on multiple outlets in parallel)

central_dish_washing.item: Commercial 3-door dishwasher + plumbing/electrical connections + chemical dispensing

electrical.gang_size: 2 electricians + 2 apprentices (parallel work on multiple outlets)

plumbing.fixtures_and_rough_in: 10 WC × 2.5 + 5 × 3-comp sinks × 3 + hand basins + rough-in ~80m = 100 hours labour

central_extraction_system.item: Central extraction plenum + 35m ducting + grease trap (300-400L) + roof penetrations
central_extraction_system.gang_size: 2 sheet metal workers + 1 labourer + 1 plumber (for grease trap)

hvac_seating_area.item: Supply + return air handling for 250m² seating, 3-zone control (3 separate zones for 5 outlets + seating)

templates.name: Bar/Pub
templates.description: Single storey bar/pub, 250m² GFA, rendered masonry, steel roof

measurement_assumptions.gfa_definition: Bar/pub GFA includes patron seating/standing area, bar counter service, back-bar spirits/beer storage, kitchen (snacks/food prep), toilets, storage/cellar.

typical_layout.patron_seating_standing: 130m² (bar seating + lounge seating, ~80-100 patrons at 1.5-2.0m² per person with circulation)
typical_layout.bar_counter_and_back_bar: 30m² (service counter ~8m × 1.2m + back-bar 3 walls × 2.5m high, spirit bottles, beer tap system)
typical_layout.cool_rooms_storage: 40m² (beer kegs, spirits storage, food cold storage, dry goods)
typical_layout.toilets: 15m² (3 cubicles + 3 basins, plus accessible WC if >100 covers)

measurement_assumptions.derivation_notes: Bar/pub (250m²) accommodates 80-100 patrons for evening drinks + casual food service. Ceiling height 3.2m (0.2m higher than cafe) supports sports TV screens + sound system. Back-bar cabinetry non-linear (fixed per venue design). Cool room 40m² for keg storage, spirits, beer stock (non-linear; bulk beverage inventory requirement). Food prep minimal (snacks, pies, burgers) vs. full restaurant. Toilet provision: 1 WC per 50-75m² bar = 3-5 cubicles (provide 3 + accessible). Grease trap required for cooking (smaller than food court, ~75-100L). Noise considerations (sound systems, live entertainment) affect fit-out finish quality.

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typically 8-12m bar counter + 3-wall back-bar cabinetry. Not scaled linearly; determined by seating capacity (100 covers = ~10m bar counter).
nonlinear_items.derivation: 250m² bar = 80-100 covers = 8-10m counter typical

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 beer keg cool room (~3m × 2.5m = 7.5m²) + 1 spirit storage cool room (~3m × 2m = 6m²) per venue. 40m² total cool space allocated.
nonlinear_items.derivation: Multiple cool rooms non-linear; bulk storage requirement for drinks service

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: Typical bar serves 10-15 beer lines (draught taps). Each tap requires CO₂ line, beer line (6-8mm), drain line from fonts.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 10-15 taps × 5m average line = 50-75m CO₂/beer lines per bar

nonlinear_items.scaling_rule: 1 WC per 75m² bar seating (250m² ÷ 75 = 3.3 → 4 cubicles minimum). Public + staff separate required.
nonlinear_items.derivation: 4 cubicles + 4 basins (includes accessible WC for >100 covers)

external_wall_area.calculation: 37.9m × 3.2m = 121.3m² (bar has moderate glazing/signage frontage, ~25% = ~30m² glass, ~91m² masonry)

flooring.formula: Flooring = GFA (heavy-duty slip-resistant, high-traffic, alcohol spills)

ceiling.formula: Ceiling = GFA × 1.06 (exposed in seating area, dropped in bar/kitchen)

back_bar_cabinetry.formula: Back-bar = 3 walls × 2.5m high × 3m × 1.2m (shelving depth) = 27m² shelf surface area
back_bar_cabinetry.notes: Non-linear; custom joinery for premium bar fit-out

bar_counter.calculation: ~13.2m linear bar counter (stainless top, kick rail, taps, POS)

power_points.formula: Power = GFA ÷ 2.5m² (bar has high electrical load for lighting, sound, kitchen)
power_points.distribution: Seating area (30 pts: lighting, music); Bar counter (20 pts: taps, fridges, POS, ice machine, lights); Kitchen (25 pts: cooking equipment); Back-bar (15 pts: lights, fridges, coolers); Toilets (4 pts); Circulation (6 pts)

light_points.notes: Include dimmer circuits for atmosphere control

plumbing_fixtures.calculation: 250m² ÷ 50 = 5 WC + 3-compartment food sink + hand basins + beer line drains + ice machine water = ~12 water connection points

beer_tap_lines.formula: CO₂ + Beer lines = 10-15 taps × 5m average line length = 50-75m total
beer_tap_lines.calculation: ~60m of beverage service lines (including returns to keg room)

back_bar_cabinetry.item: Custom back-bar (27m²) + counter (13.2m linear) + shelving installation
back_bar_cabinetry.labour_hours: 50-65 hours (custom cabinetry, assembly, shelving installation, finishing)

electrical.sound_system_infrastructure: Sound system rough-in, speaker wiring = +15 hours

plumbing_bar_service.plumbing_fixtures: 5 WC × 2.5 + 3-comp sink × 3 + hand basins × 4 + rough-in ~40m = 45 hours plumbing labour
plumbing_bar_service.beverage_lines: 10-15 tap line installation + CO₂ system + ice machine connection = 15-20 hours specialist labour
plumbing_bar_service.derivation: 45 hours plumbing ÷ 8 hrs/day = 5.6 days; 18 hours beverage = 2.25 days

kitchen_food_prep.item: Grill, warmer, fryer, prep benches, 3-comp sink

cool_room_installation.item: 2 cool rooms (beer + spirit/food storage), ~7.5m² + 6m² = 13.5m² total internal
cool_room_installation.labour_hours: 20-25 hours (assembly, sealing, electrical, temperature control setup)
